Home → New in and suggestions → Music → New music for August 2015

New music for August 2015

I cry when I laugh by Jess Glynne

Best known for featuring on Clean Bandit’s single Rather Be and Route 94’s My Love, both of which reached number one, this is the first solo album from Jess Glynne and is likely to be the sound of the summer.

Positive songs for negative people by Frank Turner

Cambridge Folk Festival star’s follow up to Tape Deck Heart is described as a record about defiance and picking yourself up when you’re down.

Another one by Mac DeMarco

More off kilter pop from the Canadian singer-songwriter.

Bad magic by Motörhead

Amazingly, this is the 22nd studio album from the world’s loudest band.

What went down by Foals

Foals continue their journey from being an impressive indie band to becoming one of the most exciting groups in Britain.

Still by Richard Thompson (Freegal)

Singer-songwriter’s sixteenth solo album, produced by Wilco’s Jeff Tweedy.
